definition: a figure whose sides are all equal
opposite_reasoning: IrregularShape provides the strongest semantic opposition to GeometricFigure based on the specific definition provided ('sides are all equal'). The regular/irregular distinction is fundamental to geometric classification and provides clear conceptual separation. While AmorphousShape is also strong, IrregularShape more directly contradicts the 'equal sides' property. For Fisher-LDA, this opposition creates a meaningful axis: regular/symmetric/equal-sided figures vs irregular/asymmetric/unequal-sided figures. This is more specific and useful than broad category opposites like Process or PhysicalSubstance.
